hedline.hl1: The Legendary Voices At Brooklyn Museum

block.p: An 11-part series of opera singers on film or video is to be presented by the Brooklyn Museum beginning at 7 P.M. tomorrow and continuing on Saturday and Sunday afternoons (except Thanksgiving weekend) through Dec. 18. Among the clips to be shown are 40 minutes of a 1961 "Tosca" starring Renata Tebaldi, 20 minutes of Leontyne Price as the New Prioress in a 1957 "Dialogues of the Carmelites," early film of Enrico Caruso and Giovanni Martinelli, a "Boheme" duet by Miss Tebaldi and Jussi Bjorling, a half-hour recital by Elisabeth Schwarzkopf, an hourlong excerpt of "Norma" with Joan Sutherland, Acts III and IV of a 1965 "Carmen" with Grace Bumbry and Jon Vickers, and Pasolini's feature film "Medea," starring Maria Callas.

An 11-part series of opera singers on film or video is to be presented by the Brooklyn Museum beginning at 7 P.M. tomorrow and continuing on Saturday and Sunday afternoons (except Thanksgiving weekend) through Dec. 18. Among the clips to be shown are 40 minutes of a 1961 "Tosca" starring Renata Tebaldi, 20 minutes of Leontyne Price as the New Prioress in a 1957 "Dialogues of the Carmelites," early film of Enrico Caruso and Giovanni Martinelli, a "Boheme" duet by Miss Tebaldi and Jussi Bjorling, a half-hour recital by Elisabeth Schwarzkopf, an hourlong excerpt of "Norma" with Joan Sutherland, Acts III and IV of a 1965 "Carmen" with Grace Bumbry and Jon Vickers, and Pasolini's feature film "Medea," starring Maria Callas.

The series is being presented in association with the Louvre in Paris and the Nederlands Filmmuseum in Amsterdam. Admission to each program at the museum (200 Eastern Parkway, at Prospect Park) is $6; $4 for museum members, students and the elderly. Information: (718) 638-5000, extension 230.
